title: FMCPAY_GLOBAL
author: FMCPAY_GLOBAL
content: According to Globant, 34% of gamers are interested in conducting crypto transactions in the Metaverse, while 16% have purchased NFTs in the past.Despite a backlash from a vocal part of the gaming community, a new survey has revealed one-third of gamers have expressed interest in using crypto in the Metaverse.And, more gamers than not believe that the Metaverse will have a positive impact on gaming.The survey was published on Wednesday by institutional software developer Globant. It was conducted by YouGov and polled 1,000 adult PC, console and/or mobile gamers last month, with 34% of respondents indicating an interest in conducting crypto transactions in Metaverse.(Source: Cointelegraph)

comments.author: crypto-project
comments.body: Metaverse and cryptocurrencies are the perfect combination, because cryptocurrencies offer financial freedom and allow users to transact without boundaries. And also various crypto features will really help to make the metaverse platform more modern.

comments.author: bluebit25
comments.body: Like a few other gamers, I am quite skeptical about the issue raised in this article, because in fact, I do not see a great deal of support from the traditional gamers around me for the new area that we mentioned. A small regional experiment doesn't mean much for the entire field and for what we've come to know about Metaverse, but I'm also very supportive of more and more relevant and quality new products.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Quote from: tomahawk9 on July 15, 2022, 03:46:30 PMFake.Anyone who spends at least 10 minutes in any popular gaming forum or discord server knows very well that every gamer (probably 9 out 10) in the hates cryptos, especially pc gamers cos they blame miners for the GPU shortage and the massive price increase in gpus (because the demand is so high)I doubt it.  I honestly really doubt it.  While I get they may be frustrated because GPU prices have exceeded limits multiple times, I doubt this led to a hatred against Cryptocurrencies.  In fact, I honestly believe it is much easier to get a gamer to understand how Bitcoin works than the average, regular Internet user.Besides, we are talking about a niche of gaming.  We are talking about Metaverse.  Metaverse users are different from typical gamers since not everyone gets to agree that VR or AR is fun and great.  Since VR and AR is kind of futuristic and the Metaverse pretty much makes you temporarily leave reality to be immersed in a fully digital world, it would make sense if a large percentage of Metaverse gamers wanted Cryptocurrency transactions to be part of the experience.-Regards,PrivacyG

However, everything is changing now and the players are no longer safe from those who are chasing their goal of earning money and playing at the same time.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: One would hope that this survey is a true reflection of the situation in the Metaverse. If the speculative trend does not change, then all these projects, even among those with a quality and original product, will become victims of market speculation. After all, users see these tokens as just a good way to get rich quickly, and this negatively affects the promotion of Metaverse and other trends in the crypto industry.
